about.title: About
about.contextFirstParagraph: This project was born out of a desire to create a portfolio that would be both fun and original.
about.contextSecondParagraph: The idea was to create the Windows XP computer interface, which would allow visitors to browse the folders and files in my computer's session.
about.contextThirdParagraph: I wanted to present my projects from a different angle, where users could wander around. Something more than just a business card on the web. Something interactive.
about.contextFourthParagraph: The project was designed to be as close as possible to a real Windows XP computer interface, with a desktop, folders, and files.
about.contextFifthParagraph: Windows XP is the first operating system I used, and it's design is a madeleine de proust for me. I wanted to pay tribute to it.
about.contextSixthParagraph: This project was created with Vue.js, Vuex, Vue Router, and SCSS. It took me about a year to complete (on and off).
about.contextSeventhParagraph: This project has been made with a lot of passion and patience, and I hope you enjoy browsing through my computer!
about.helpFirst: This project was carried out with the help of Dockurr windows xp, which enabled me to run a Windows XP environment on my computer very easily.
about.helpSecond: Spotify's API enabled me to retrieve my playlist information, display it on my site and add an integrated player.
about.helpThird: For the server side, I used a Node.js server to compile the site and manage the contact form. The website is hosted on hostinger and the CI / CD is made using my homeserver.
about.helpFourth: I was able to recover the Windows XP images and integrate them into my project thanks to the internet archive website. Many thanks to them.
about.helpFifth: My cat partly helped by stepping on my keyboard, but mostly she was a moral support.

logma.contextFirstParagraph: Logma production is a movie production company based in Rennes. Founded by Baptiste Fablet. At the start of this project, there was already a logma production site created by the company director with Wordpress.
logma.contextSecondParagraph: The decision was made to rebuild this site from scratch, with a simple, tried-and-tested technical stack, to try and make a website without a Framework and without someoneonce helping to make it fast and efficient.
logma.contextThirdParagraph: In order to make the entrepreneur autonomous in the management of this site, it was necessary to develop a back-office from which he could publish new photos, add projects and links to his videos.
logma.goalFirst: Redesign of website with existing graphic identity
logma.goalThird: Develop a back-office to manage the site
logma.goalFifth: Improve loading speed and overall performance

aidella.contextFirstParagraph: Les Terres d'Aidella is a dog breeding kennel located in the Vosges region. Passionate animal lovers with the goal of sharing their passion and expertise with as many people as possible.
aidella.contextSecondParagraph: The problem was that their web presence was very limited, and they had no platform to showcase their activities online apart from their Facebook page.
aidella.contextThirdParagraph: So we addressed this with Nathan Fournil in charge of content creation and writing, and myself responsible for the design, website development, and deployment.
aidella.goalSecond: Increase visibility by working on SEO
aidella.goalThird: Develop a back office for content management
aidella.goalFourth: Create an intuitive and visually appealing interface for visitors
aidella.goalFifth: Allow visitors to discover the different dog breeds
aidella.goalSixth: Present the kennel and its activities
aidella.tasksDoneFirst: Design and modeling of the relational database
aidella.tasksDoneFirstDetails: We had to consider the client‚Äôs needs and present a robust and scalable model.
aidella.tasksDoneSecondDetails: Laravel was chosen for its MVC pattern and MySQL database, providing a solid stack for building and improving the project in the future. Additionally, using Orchid for the back office made content management easier.
aidella.tasksDoneThird: The front-end was developed with Vue.js
aidella.tasksDoneThirdDetails: Each page is a Blade template, based on a page model that contains all metadata tags, avoiding the need to use Vue for SEO management.
aidella.tasksDoneFourthDetails: Orchid allows for easy content management. It is possible to create pages, articles, categories, images, users, etc., all through an intuitive and user-friendly interface.
aidella.tasksDoneFifth: Deployment pipeline to a third-party web server
aidella.tasksDoneFifthDetails: Thanks to the Homeserver project, the project can be precompiled with Jenkins and the artifact sent to the production server. A change to the `main` branch of the Git repository is enough for the site to be automatically updated. The database is also updated with migrations using the `make deploy` command from the Makefile.
aidella.tasksDoneFifthDetailsSecond: This method saves significant time and avoids needing npm or any JS package manager on the production server.

discreteMath.contextFirstParagraph: Discrete Math Escape Room is an educational 2D top-down RPG developed in Godot Engine designed to teach computer science and discrete mathematics concepts through interactive gameplay.
discreteMath.contextSecondParagraph: The game follows a student trapped in a mysterious room where they must solve logic puzzles and cryptographic challenges based on real discrete math concepts to escape.
discreteMath.contextThirdParagraph: This project was developed as a capstone project from September 2025 to December 2025 to demonstrate game development skills while creating an engaging educational tool that makes learning complex mathematical concepts fun and interactive.
discreteMath.goalFirst: Create an engaging educational experience that teaches discrete mathematics
discreteMath.goalSecond: Implement interactive mini-games for Affine Ciphers, Set Theory, and Truth Tables
discreteMath.goalThird: Design intuitive game mechanics and player interactions
discreteMath.goalFourth: Develop a compelling narrative that motivates players to learn
discreteMath.goalFifth: Build a robust dialogue and progression system
discreteMath.goalSixth: Create polished UI/UX flows including menus and HUD
discreteMath.tasksDoneFirstDetails: Engineered three distinct educational mini-games: an Affine Cipher decoder that teaches cryptography concepts, a Set Theory puzzle using a grid system like classic Battleship games, and a Truth Table logic challenge. Each mini-game was designed to be both educational and entertaining, with clear visual feedback and progressive difficulty.
discreteMath.tasksDoneSecondDetails: Built a robust interaction system using Area2D nodes and a Singleton-based dialogue manager to handle game state, NPC conversations, and narrative progression. The system supports branching dialogues, quest tracking, and dynamic responses based on player progress.
discreteMath.tasksDoneThirdDetails: Designed and implemented comprehensive user interface flows including a polished main menu, pause menu with settings, and a dynamic player HUD displaying health, quest objectives, and inventory. All interfaces were designed with pixel-art aesthetics to match the game's visual style.
discreteMath.tasksDoneFourthDetails: Created multiple interconnected rooms each containing unique puzzles and challenges.

mazeEscape.contextFirstParagraph: Maze Escape is a thrilling 2D top-down dungeon crawler adventure game developed in Unity as a final project for Game Design and Development course (GAM145) in Fall 2024.
mazeEscape.contextSecondParagraph: The game challenges players to navigate through procedurally generated maze-like dungeons filled with enemies, power-ups, and strategic combat encounters while searching for the exit to advance to the next level.
mazeEscape.contextThirdParagraph: This project demonstrates advanced Unity development skills including enemy AI behaviors, procedural level generation, player movement and combat mechanics, and comprehensive game systems that create an engaging roguelike experience.
mazeEscape.goalFirst: Create an engaging 2D dungeon crawler with smooth player controls and combat
mazeEscape.goalSecond: Implement diverse enemy types with unique AI behaviors and attack patterns
mazeEscape.goalThird: Design a robust power-up and upgrade system to enhance gameplay progression
mazeEscape.goalFourth: Develop intuitive UI/UX with health bars, score tracking, and visual feedback
mazeEscape.goalFifth: Build scalable level progression system with increasing difficulty
mazeEscape.goalSixth: Optimize game performance and create polished game feel with particle effects and animations
mazeEscape.tasksDoneFirstDetails: Implemented comprehensive player controller with WASD movement, mouse-aim shooting mechanics, and bullet physics. Created a responsive shooting system that allows players to fire projectiles toward mouse cursor position, with proper collision detection and damage calculation. Added visual feedback through muzzle flash effects and impact particles.
mazeEscape.tasksDoneSecondDetails: Developed multiple enemy types including patrol enemies with waypoint navigation, chase enemies that pursue the player when detected, ranged enemies that maintain distance while firing projectiles, and burn enemies that deal damage over time. Each enemy type features unique behaviors, health systems, and death animations with particle effects.
mazeEscape.tasksDoneThirdDetails: Designed and implemented various power-ups including health restoration, speed boosts, damage multipliers, and shield protection. Created a collectable system with visual pickup effects and HUD integration. Implemented score tracking and level progression mechanics that increase difficulty as players advance through dungeons.
mazeEscape.tasksDoneFourthDetails: Built challenging boss enemies with multiple attack phases, unique movement patterns, and special abilities. Implemented boss health bars, enrage mechanics, and victory conditions. Created dramatic boss arenas with environmental hazards and strategic combat encounters that test player skill and mastery of game mechanics.

nourishNet.contextFirstParagraph: NourishNet is a cross-platform mobile application developed using React Native and Expo, designed to connect individuals in need with local community resources such as food banks, shelters, and other essential services.
nourishNet.contextSecondParagraph: The app leverages real-time geolocation services to help users find nearby resources quickly and efficiently, providing interactive map views, distance-based filtering, and the ability to save favorite locations for easy access.
nourishNet.contextThirdParagraph: This project was developed as a final mobile development project from November 2025 to December 2025, demonstrating proficiency in React Native, Firebase integration, Google Maps API, and modern mobile UI/UX design principles while addressing a real social need in communities.
nourishNet.goalFirst: Create an intuitive mobile app connecting users with community resources
nourishNet.goalSecond: Implement real-time geolocation and interactive mapping features
nourishNet.goalThird: Design a responsive and accessible user interface for all users
nourishNet.goalFourth: Integrate Firebase backend for dynamic data management
nourishNet.goalFifth: Enable users to save and manage favorite resource locations
nourishNet.goalSixth: Provide distance-based filtering and multiple view options (map/list)
nourishNet.tasksDoneFirstDetails: Built a cross-platform mobile application using React Native with Expo framework, enabling deployment to both iOS and Android from a single codebase. Implemented navigation using React Navigation with stack and tab navigators for seamless user experience. Configured development environment with proper dependencies and build settings for optimal performance.
nourishNet.tasksDoneSecondDetails: Integrated Google Maps API and Expo Location services to provide real-time geolocation features. Implemented interactive map markers showing resource locations with custom icons and information windows. Created distance calculation functionality using Haversine formula to display proximity of resources from user's current location. Added map/list toggle views allowing users to switch between visual map representation and detailed list format with distance-based sorting.
nourishNet.tasksDoneThirdDetails: Developed a robust backend using Firebase Firestore for real-time database management, storing resource information including names, addresses, types, operating hours, and contact details. Implemented efficient data retrieval with query optimization for fast loading times. Integrated Firebase Authentication for user account management and secure access to personalized features.
nourishNet.tasksDoneFourthDetails: Implemented AsyncStorage for local persistence of user preferences and favorite resource locations. Created a favorites management system allowing users to bookmark important resources for quick access without internet connection. Designed intuitive UI for adding, removing, and viewing saved locations with visual feedback and confirmation dialogs.

gameAssetAiAgent.contextFirstParagraph: Game Asset AI Agent is an innovative web application that leverages artificial intelligence to generate custom game assets for game developers and designers.
gameAssetAiAgent.contextSecondParagraph: The application combines a modern React frontend with a powerful Python Flask backend, utilizing Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash API for intelligent asset descriptions and Clipdrop's API to generate the actual images (first 100 free), creating contextually appropriate game assets including characters, items, environments, and UI elements based on user descriptions and requirements.
gameAssetAiAgent.contextThirdParagraph: This project demonstrates the integration of AI-powered content generation into game development workflows, providing developers with a tool to rapidly prototype and generate game assets while maintaining creative control over the output.
gameAssetAiAgent.goalFirst: Create an AI-powered tool for generating game assets on demand
gameAssetAiAgent.goalSecond: Implement an intuitive React-based user interface for asset creation
gameAssetAiAgent.goalThird: Build a robust Flask backend with Gemini and Clipdrop API integration
gameAssetAiAgent.goalFourth: Enable customizable asset generation with user-defined parameters
gameAssetAiAgent.goalFifth: Provide real-time preview and download capabilities for generated assets
gameAssetAiAgent.goalSixth: Design a scalable architecture supporting multiple asset types
gameAssetAiAgent.tasksDoneFirstDetails: Built a modern, responsive web interface using React and Vite for fast development and optimal performance. Implemented component-based architecture for reusable UI elements including asset parameter forms, preview galleries, and generation controls. Created intuitive input fields allowing users to specify asset requirements such as style, colors, dimensions, and contextual descriptions.
gameAssetAiAgent.tasksDoneSecondDetails: Developed a RESTful API using Python Flask to handle asset generation requests and communicate with Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash API and Clipdrop's image generation API. Implemented secure environment variable management for API keys and sensitive configuration. Created request validation and error handling to ensure reliable asset generation with proper fallbacks for API failures or rate limiting.
gameAssetAiAgent.tasksDoneThirdDetails: Integrated Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash for intelligent conversation with users to understand their asset requirements, then utilized Clipdrop's API to generate actual images with the first 100 generations free. Implemented prompt engineering techniques to produce consistent, game-ready asset descriptions that match user requirements. Created a multi-step generation pipeline that interprets user requirements, generates conceptual descriptions through Gemini, and produces visual assets via Clipdrop.
gameAssetAiAgent.tasksDoneFourthDetails: Developed a comprehensive asset management system allowing users to preview, edit, and download generated assets. Implemented export functionality supporting multiple formats suitable for various game engines and development tools. Created a user-friendly interface for organizing generated assets into projects or collections with metadata tracking and version history.

portfolioXP.contextFirstParagraph: PortfolioXP is an interactive portfolio website designed as a faithful recreation of the iconic Windows XP operating system interface, bringing nostalgic computing experiences to the modern web.
portfolioXP.contextSecondParagraph: Built with Vue.js 3, Vite, Tailwind CSS, and SCSS, this project demonstrates advanced frontend development skills through pixel-perfect UI replication, custom animations, state management with Pinia stores, and internationalization support for English, Hebrew, and French languages.
portfolioXP.contextThirdParagraph: The portfolio transforms the traditional resume format into an engaging, exploratory experience where visitors can navigate through desktop icons, open windows, browse projects, play games like Minesweeper and DOOM, listen to music, view a CV, send emails, and interact with a fully functional Windows XP-themed environment that showcases development projects in an innovative and memorable way.
portfolioXP.goalFirst: Recreate the Windows XP interface with pixel-perfect accuracy and authentic interactions
portfolioXP.goalSecond: Build a modular component architecture for reusable UI elements and windows
portfolioXP.goalThird: Implement state management for window positioning, open applications, and user preferences
portfolioXP.goalFourth: Create an internationalized experience supporting multiple languages (English, Hebrew, French)
portfolioXP.goalFifth: Integrate interactive features including music player, image gallery, calendar, and contact form
portfolioXP.goalSixth: Optimize performance and accessibility while maintaining the retro aesthetic
portfolioXP.tasksDoneFirstDetails: Developed a comprehensive component-based architecture using Vue.js 3 Composition API with over 50 custom components including windows, buttons, menus, modals, and interactive elements. Implemented Vue Router for navigation between Loader and Office views, managing the login flow and desktop experience. Created reusable layout components like Window.vue, ContentCenter.vue, and DesktopAppsLayout.vue that provide consistent structure across all application windows. Utilized Pinia stores (windowsStore, localeStore, connectionStore, volumeStore, desktopIconsStore, goBackStore) for centralized state management with localStorage persistence.
portfolioXP.tasksDoneSecondDetails: Meticulously recreated the Windows XP visual design system including the iconic Bliss wallpaper, Luna theme colors, gradient backgrounds, window chrome with minimize/maximize/close buttons, start menu with animated transitions, taskbar with system tray, and authentic cursors. Implemented pixel-perfect CSS gradients matching the original Windows XP UI, custom fonts (MS Sans Serif, Tahoma, Trebuchet MS), and responsive layouts that adapt the XP interface to modern screen sizes. Added subtle animations and hover effects that mirror the original OS interactions, creating an immersive nostalgic experience.
portfolioXP.tasksDoneThirdDetails: Integrated Vue I18n for comprehensive internationalization supporting English, Hebrew (RTL), and French languages with over 300 translation keys across all UI elements, project descriptions, and system messages. Created a structured data management system using JSON files (projects-data.json, cv-data.json, playlist-data.json, pictures-data.json, terminal-data.json, windows-data.json, header-menu-data.json) for easy content updates without code changes. Implemented dynamic component loading based on project selection, allowing each project to have its own detailed content component with custom layouts and media.
portfolioXP.tasksDoneFourthDetails: Established a complete CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins for automated builds and deployments, integrated SonarQube for code quality analysis and maintaining clean code standards, and created Docker containerization with nginx web server for consistent production deployments. Configured GitHub Pages deployment workflow for hosting the portfolio website with proper base path configuration. Implemented build optimization with Vite bundler for fast load times, code splitting, and efficient asset delivery. Added comprehensive E2E testing using Nightwatch.js to ensure functionality across different browsers and maintain quality assurance throughout development iterations.
